Every year the King and his people visited Lake Guatavita, to make sacrifice to its presiding deity; the people bearing their most precious possessions, the King smeared with gum and anointed with gold dust. Embarking on a raft, the King was rowed to the middle of the lake. Then he plunged in and washed off his golden coat, while the multitudes around stand and threw their offerings in the waters. How ignoble, by comparison seems the action of the British company which, in 1903, obtained permission to drain the lake!”
